definition: variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)
not yet/did not/have not/not/8th earthly branch: 1-3 p.m., 6th solar month (7th July-6th August), year of the Sheep/ancient Chinese compass point: 210°

sentences.english: Never too old to learn, never too late to turn.
sentences.chinese: 活到老学到老，亡羊补牢为时未晚。

sentences.english: You really should break the habit of reading your horoscope every day, before it's too late.
sentences.chinese: 你得改掉这个每天都算命的习惯，亡羊补牢为时未晚。

sentences.english: Our mission is to help them get back on track before it's too late.
sentences.chinese: 我们的任务是趁着为时未晚，帮助他们回到正轨。

sentences.english: I think that no matter what reason for smoking, it's never too late to quit smoking.
sentences.chinese: 我认为不管因为什么原因而吸烟，戒烟都为时未晚。

sentences.english: It’s not too late to get started.
Let's settle our differences before it's too late.
sentences.chinese: 趁现在为时未晚，我们来解决彼此的分歧吧。

sentences.english: Dr. Carmona said it is never too late to stop smoking.
sentences.chinese: 卡莫纳博士说，这是戒烟为时未晚。

sentences.english: Face the problem beforeit's too late.
sentences.chinese: 面对问题，现在还为时未晚。

definition: lit. to mend the pen after sheep are lost (idiom)/fig. to act belatedly/better late than never/to lock the stable door after the horse has bolted
lit. to rein in the horse at the edge of the precipice (idiom)/fig. to act in the nick of time
to get back on the right path/to mend one's ways
the old man lost his mare, but it all turned out for the best (idiom); fig. a blessing in disguise/it's an ill wind that blows nobody any good
pinyin: sai4 weng1 shi1 ma3 yan1 zhi1 fei1 fu2

definition: lit. before it rains, bind around with silk (idiom, from Book of Songs 詩經|诗经); fig. to plan ahead/to prepare for a rainy day
to realize suddenly/to wake up to the truth/to suddenly awake from sleep
to lose at sunrise but gain at sunset (idiom)/to compensate later for one's earlier loss/what you lose on the swings you gain on the roundabouts
pinyin: shi1 zhi1 dong1 yu2 , shou1 zhi1 sang1 yu2
